abstract.text: Encodes a command that copies image data from a texture’s slice into another slice.

For textures that use a PVRTC pixel format, you can use this method to copy the entire texture, but not a subregion of the texture.
Copying data to overlapping regions within the same texture may result in unexpected behavior.

abstract.text: Render advanced 3D graphics and compute data in parallel with graphics processors.
An interface you can use to encode GPU commands that copy and modify the underlying memory of various Metal resources.
Encodes a command that copies image data from a texture’s slice into another slice.
Encodes a command that copies slices of a texture to another texture’s slices.
Encodes a command that copies data from one texture to another.
The coordinates for the front upper-left corner of a region.
The y coordinate of the origin.
The z coordinate of the origin.
The number of elements in the z dimension.
The number of elements in the y dimension.
A resource that holds formatted image data.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the texture can only be used as a render target.
Use a blit command encoder to copy buffer or texture data to a private resource.

doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Meta.title: Copying Data to a Private Resource
